title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.39 | 08-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dhasya Gyananjan Shalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers, invoking blessings and paying respects to the spiritual master and Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: At the moment of death, let my ultimate attraction be to Shri Krishna, the personality of Godhead.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.9.39) focusing on Bhishma Deva's prayer to be attracted to Krishna at the time of death and how seeing Krishna on the battlefield granted liberation.

segments.key_quote: Each one of us, we belong to the spiritual world and our goal of life should be to attain that eternal relationship.
segments.summary: The lecture emphasizes the concept of Swaroopa (original form), our eternal relationship with Krishna, and how attaining this relationship is the ultimate goal of life.

segments.key_quote: Even for a moment, a pure devotee does not forget the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difference between a pure devotee and a conditioned soul, highlighting the constant Krishna consciousness of a devotee and comparing the process of Bhakti Yoga to Ashtanga Yoga in attaining Samadhi.

segments.key_quote: The concentration of the mystic yogi is mechanical whereas that of the pure devotee is natural in pure love and spontaneous affection.
segments.summary: The lecture describes the transcendental nature of Krishna's pastimes and the loving exchange between the Lord and his devotees, contrasting the mechanical concentration of a mystic yogi with the spontaneous affection of a pure devotee.

segments.key_quote: Our heart actually is full of love for Krishna in the pure state of our consciousness.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how material contamination clouds our innate love for Krishna, and explains the eternal nature of Krishna's pastimes, using the analogy of the sun rising in different parts of the world.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is continuously performing his pastimes in one universe after another universe.
segments.summary: The lecture continues to elaborate on the eternal nature of Krishna's pastimes, explaining how they occur continuously across different universes, and mentions the eternal associates of the Lord.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva never forgot the beautiful feature of the Lord as Partha Sarathi, which even Arjuna could not see.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Bhishma Deva's unique vision of Krishna as Parthasarathi and emphasizes that the Lord displays different forms according to the relationship he has with each devotee.

segments.key_quote: Everyone attained their original spiritual form after death, because Krishna was present on the battlefield when they were dying.
segments.summary: The lecture explains that those who died on the battlefield of Kurukshetra attained their original spiritual form due to Krishna's presence, and emphasizes the importance of one's consciousness at the time of death.

segments.key_quote: Till one breaks this cycle of repetition of birth and death by engaging in devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the cycle of birth and death, the foreign nature of material forms, and how devotional service is the key to liberation and attaining one's original spiritual form.

segments.key_quote: The devotees when they take to Krishna consciousness and perfect their devotional service they never come back to the material world after going to the spiritual.
segments.summary: The lecture contrasts the paths of impersonalists and devotees, highlighting the instability of merging into the Brahman effulgence versus the eternal shelter found at Krishna's lotus feet in the spiritual world, emphasizing the devotees never return to the material world.
